TopicTitle: What do you HATE about KSP?

Articles.Content: Maximum time warp is not nearly enough for me.

I hate that more of the cool mods are not pulled into be stock like Triggers alternate resource panel or <abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr>\<abbr title="Kerbal Attachment System (mod)">KAS</abbr>
The lack of a proper career mode.
Maneuver nodes spazzing into deep space

Maneuver nodes. It was a great tool to learn the game and use it for small trips, it has become a major hindrance for executing complex trips or small, discrete adjustments. The reason why is broke its because it relies on two very imperfect tools: the movement of the mouse, which can get stuck or "catch " on a small imperfection of the mousepad creating great surges into the vectors adjustment and player's wrist. Sadly we're not all 12 and our wrists don't function the way they did 30 years ago.

Yes, there are mods to alleviate the problem, but every time I use a maneuver node, I get the feeling an early alpha mechanic is still in the game and is not very good at what it suppose to do.

Hate?  Nothing. It's not perfect, but who cares, it's too much fun.

Career could be better in many ways for me. I like the idea, but it's just that it doesn't appeal to me as it is now.
"Cannot time warp more than 50x below "

You can timewarp from the tracking station.

Also, rescue contracts get harder the more of them you do.  I took a contract for $160,000 and didn't stop to wonder why it paid so well, turns out, he was beyond the moon's orbit.

Maybe it's your OS. The OS that your computer comes with is the one it is hardwired for, and as you update it becomes less and less capable of complex programs such as KSP. This is why my old 4.0 GHz Mac can't run Safari. (yeh its from the 1800s) And, yes there are bugs with the docking ports. I looked at the models for the ports and there are some misaligned polygons in the window part of the port so I suggest getting Ven's stock part revamp. My new Mac can run fine at 180 FPS with a 14400 part Io base in <abbr title="Real Solar System (mod)">RSS</abbr> and about 200,000 ton boosters. 

As with the docking ports, the old shake it off Kraken is back. 

All the best,

M.Reynolds

Lack of geological features on planets. Io-style volcanism would make Tylo 80% cooler, but even mere collision meshes for ground scatter would be a nice start.

It should be stock, it is stupid to go back and forth between tracking station(or some probe lying on the surface of a planet) just to time warp faster. It is supposed to be a safety feature so that players cannot skip through the atmosphere...well just go to tracking station then

Spoiler

Obvously I dont \*hate\* KSP, or hate playing it, KSP is great/awesome/unique/special/cool. But if I had to choose something to hate, it'd be this:

I hate that a good career game takes me about 6 months, and every time I start a new career after a major update, Im only halfway through before another update comes along and wrecks my mod build. I'm still waiting to see if I have to ditch my current playthrough after 1.1.3, most likely I will wait for 1.2, will probably have to start a new career, and will probably have to ditch that one too for 1.3 or 1.2.1 or whatever.
